list.name: Default
list.comment:
lots more net sync. block breaking, block placement all works, as well as verifying that that equipped item can do those things
and do the appropriate action..

task.summary: Default task

player spawning/serialization works \o/
the tile renderer even centers on the players spawned position. still a very long ways to go before achieving my past parity
almost (main) player rendering

tilerenderer working with a textureatlas
which was packed with texturepacker..works well, i think. tilerenderer seems to have some really bad bug on zooming, where it misrenderers entire rows and columsn of blocks (rendering incorrect block types)
actually add the assets -_-

tilemap rendering proper texture of each Block
and generates a random (proof of concept of course), world map
movement system beginnings..

port most of movement system (probably)
update gdx and friends

fix spawning, timeouts(for debug), several null refs..player spawns and physics..physics
but it seems to keep moving to the right, assuming due to no velocity bleed off

initialize world blocks for client, but in a different manner.
turns out i'm not yet sending the client the tile region

less movement key issues. reset it to zero each tick, fix velocity clamp mess up
speed is too fast right now for some reason, got lost in the port

initial chunk sending is nearly working
had some showstoppers with me screwing up the rectangle positioning, still another bug where the chunk top-left starts at player position (should be centered on it)
also had a showstopper with kryonet's read buffer. apparently it does not auto resize its serialization buffers. 32768 (2^15) should be okay..the previous object size was 2^14-1000 or so
we may want to set up a queuing mechanism later, as 15,000 bytes is quite a bit (mtu is 1500)
center loaded region around player now
create a zoom timer so we don't have to keep pressing it, and so that holding it doesn't go too fast/slow

fix player spawning. physics seems to..move a bit
somehow the movement/accel is really slow. vector was scaled by delta which seems to have made it none

jump is entirely implemented now, and the errors therein uncovered...
collision is off by a block or two. more likely, the rendering of the sprite is.
have not yet figured out why movement speed..and everything physicy is so slow.. timestep interval is identical, delta seems to be passed properly...
fix movement speed a lot, and gravity slightly.
sprite rendering/origin is proper now. physics looks to be working well.

actually fix the timestep, apparently. probably will need improvements later on
but at least now it doesn't slow down as your cpu speeds up ;)

fix periodic loaded region sending
it'll need a lot of tweaking, but it's basically back to where it was...and much simpler. yet still need to do entity spawning/loading...among other things..

lots of ui stuff (default skin, json etc), chat dialog added
using atlases now as well, all over, packed automatically at each runtime via texturepacker.
chat dialog has scrolling working, scrolls to bottom..multi line word wrap..scrolling is even kinetic and looks very nice. i'm quite impressed with scene2d.ui, this is probably the easiest i've gotten a chat dialog up and running and i've tried many ui libs. now to try the inventory and dragging/dropping..that's where the "fun" may or may not start. seems like it's got builtin d&d stuff, which is a lot better than most it looks.

lots of ui stuff (default skin, json etc), chat dialog added
using atlases now as well, all over, packed automatically at each runtime via texturepacker.
chat dialog has scrolling working, scrolls to bottom..multi line word wrap..scrolling is even kinetic and looks very nice. i'm quite impressed with scene2d.ui, this is probably the easiest i've gotten a chat dialog up and running and i've tried many ui libs. now to try the inventory and dragging/dropping..that's where the "fun" may or may not start. seems like it's got builtin d&d stuff, which is a lot better than most it looks.
start of hotbar inventory ui

add build date to output jar, and name it something other than "desktop-1.0.jar". comment out texturepacker code for now
this will probably be enabled by a debug flag so i can use it for my purposes quickly and easily. wish there was a manner for someone else to easily do so as well, when i give them a jar..but i cannot think of one.

add player sprite and make him render properly. make texturepacker run on --pack..probably only works when run from IDEA
given how all the paths work and stuff...

very basic proof of concept for inventory dragging & dropping..
gotta figure out how to nicely make each slot a dragger and a dropper..
add glprofiler information to debug hud

dragging and dropping of hotbarinventory *looks* well behaved now
doesn't yet drag...or use any of its information, that'll be a whole thing to get that working. and the backend(s) for the inventory

hotbarinventory serialization over network and loading etc..
caught a few bugs along the way, big ones especially one that was hidden but could cause a player to try and spawn twice.. left to do is drag & drop of items and the network backing for that rearrangement. that's just for the hotbar for now.
the hotbar items server-side, stack size gets randomized as well, just to make it different.

add F10, f11 etc keys to disable tile and gui rendering.
this tipped me off on the fact that i was accidentally calling render() twice on the tile renderer, hah. that explains that odd effect when you move, the tiles subtly bend/stretch. kind of interesting how that happened. maybe it integrated position after the first call but before the second..

hotbar inventory now allows rearrangment of items
couple bugs in it, needs some better indicator hints too. doesn't yet tell the server anything happened, though. very neat, too. the code is clean, concise..has way better indication on dropping (like a drag icon, droppable areas will highlight a color), all stuff we get For Free, far better than the other ui was capable of..
infrastructure is getting there to make it generic and drag & droppable between the hotbar and the main inventory (which is yet to be written). i'm really happy with this listener approach to notifying inventory changes from the model, to the view. anything can just sign up for it, get notifications in a very discrete manner, and do exactly what they need to do(as evidenced by the server, inventoryview code), it's really quite nice.

fix build name generation (last commit made the 'dist' task fail oddly), forgot that colons aren't probably good in most pathnames.
use yyyy-MM-dd-time-hh-mm instead..maybe a bit more legible.
hotbar inventory drag & drop is a lot more intuitive now, gives visual cues on dragging validity
slightly more resilient hotbar inventory, now allows mouse wheel selection + click selection

do not allow dragging to start on a null item
also, make the client thread wait (if in hosting mode), before it shuts down everything else, it must wait for the server to cleanup and return and stop.
add inventory window, drag & drop between it and hotbar works *beautifully*
add some inventory spacing, don't assert on KeepAlive packets
chat is hooked up to the network now, craft some neat logic to hide/show the chat on enter (required a good amount of input modifications)
create chat messages of type 'server', and handle those properly
fix player movement input regression, was acting really weird/keys sticking

don't try to send chat, client side if text is null. also send it when enter is pressed, as well as close it.
need to show an animation though when ones are received.
make sidebar buttons for various gui action things

make chat enter a notification kind of mode when it receives something..this was very tricky to get right
it has 3 states, hidden, notification, which is when it's super transparent, textbox is hidden, can't be scrollable etc, and normal...took a while to get the input to handle properly, pretty sure there's a couple dupe'd state changes here that i may be able to condense without issue.
add some minor hacks to get chat scrolling not being a pita
tell the server a drag op occurred
hotbar select packets...block picking now works as well, also the crosshair rendering
don't forget to add entities to world..no visible issues with it yet though

beginnings of loading various types of entities into the hotbarinventory, and serializing over the network
and displaying properly their textures according to atlas...main inventory needs fixes incorporated
bit of code cleanup in client, also don't try to destroy a block + send packet if it's already a null block at index

lots more net sync. block breaking, block placement all works, as well as verifying that that equipped item can do those things
and do the appropriate action..

MESSAGE.value:
very basic proof of concept for inventory dragging & dropping..
gotta figure out how to nicely make each slot a dragger and a dropper..
add glprofiler information to debug hud

dragging and dropping of hotbarinventory *looks* well behaved now
doesn't yet drag...or use any of its information, that'll be a whole thing to get that working. and the backend(s) for the inventory

hotbarinventory serialization over network and loading etc..
caught a few bugs along the way, big ones especially one that was hidden but could cause a player to try and spawn twice.. left to do is drag & drop of items and the network backing for that rearrangement. that's just for the hotbar for now.
the hotbar items server-side, stack size gets randomized as well, just to make it different.

add F10, f11 etc keys to disable tile and gui rendering.
this tipped me off on the fact that i was accidentally calling render() twice on the tile renderer, hah. that explains that odd effect when you move, the tiles subtly bend/stretch. kind of interesting how that happened. maybe it integrated position after the first call but before the second..

hotbar inventory now allows rearrangment of items
couple bugs in it, needs some better indicator hints too. doesn't yet tell the server anything happened, though. very neat, too. the code is clean, concise..has way better indication on dropping (like a drag icon, droppable areas will highlight a color), all stuff we get For Free, far better than the other ui was capable of..
infrastructure is getting there to make it generic and drag & droppable between the hotbar and the main inventory (which is yet to be written). i'm really happy with this listener approach to notifying inventory changes from the model, to the view. anything can just sign up for it, get notifications in a very discrete manner, and do exactly what they need to do(as evidenced by the server, inventoryview code), it's really quite nice.

fix build name generation (last commit made the 'dist' task fail oddly), forgot that colons aren't probably good in most pathnames.
use yyyy-MM-dd-time-hh-mm instead..maybe a bit more legible.
hotbar inventory drag & drop is a lot more intuitive now, gives visual cues on dragging validity
slightly more resilient hotbar inventory, now allows mouse wheel selection + click selection

do not allow dragging to start on a null item
also, make the client thread wait (if in hosting mode), before it shuts down everything else, it must wait for the server to cleanup and return and stop.
add inventory window, drag & drop between it and hotbar works *beautifully*
add some inventory spacing, don't assert on KeepAlive packets
chat is hooked up to the network now, craft some neat logic to hide/show the chat on enter (required a good amount of input modifications)
create chat messages of type 'server', and handle those properly
fix player movement input regression, was acting really weird/keys sticking

don't try to send chat, client side if text is null. also send it when enter is pressed, as well as close it.
need to show an animation though when ones are received.
make sidebar buttons for various gui action things

make chat enter a notification kind of mode when it receives something..this was very tricky to get right
it has 3 states, hidden, notification, which is when it's super transparent, textbox is hidden, can't be scrollable etc, and normal...took a while to get the input to handle properly, pretty sure there's a couple dupe'd state changes here that i may be able to condense without issue.
add some minor hacks to get chat scrolling not being a pita
tell the server a drag op occurred
hotbar select packets...block picking now works as well, also the crosshair rendering
don't forget to add entities to world..no visible issues with it yet though

beginnings of loading various types of entities into the hotbarinventory, and serializing over the network
and displaying properly their textures according to atlas...main inventory needs fixes incorporated
bit of code cleanup in client, also don't try to destroy a block + send packet if it's already a null block at index

lots more net sync. block breaking, block placement all works, as well as verifying that that equipped item can do those things
and do the appropriate action..
